metadata.synopsis: Shadowheart meets with her parents once again, who have been imprisoned for decades. A vision of Shar appears and demands Shadowheart sacrifice her parents.Note: there are two major tracks in this scene - if SH comes to it as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess's command, or as someone who has turned from Shar and is coming to rescue her parents.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. Go to grotto with shadowheart2. Talk to Viconia3. Beat Viconia4. Go to Chamber of Loss6. Talk to Parents

75.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
75.text: It can't be. Another vile trick -
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart approaches two upright discs upon which an elf man and human woman are restrained to each. (This should be reminiscent of the figure SH glimpsed in Shar's symbol during her vision after killing Nightsong). The elf man lifts his head to see Shadowheart and reacts with disbelief. His disc flares. He breaks off with a cry of pain.NodeContext: Disbelieving. Cut off at the end by a flare of magically triggered pain

45.speaker: Shadowheart
45.text: That was me. I did that. How...?
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks down - her hand pulses with her Shar-given power.NodeContext: Confused. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

111.context: CinematicNodeContext: The chamber seems to grow darker suddenly. Shadowheart sees a vast silhouette of Shar leaning over her and her parents, in the same pose that the huge Shar statue at the centre of her temple in act 2 took (left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left) Shar's features cannot be clearly seen, but her words reverberate through SH's head.

160.speaker: Shar
160.text: This was my gift to you. Power is not created; it merely changes from one form to another. Their pain becomes your might. Their suffering furthers your glory.
160.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shar lowers the sword arm (right arm) out of view and gazes intently down at SH and co. Left arm still appears to be holding them up.NodeContext: Shar pose -starts with left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left. Then lowers the sword arm to her side (out of view for player) and stands looming over SH and co, left hand still appearing to hold them up.

56.speaker: Shadowheart
56.text: I don't understand - who are these people?
56.context: NodeContext: Apprehension rising. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

107.speaker: Shar
107.text: Arnell Hallowleaf and his wife, Emmeline.
107.context: NodeContext: All-poweful, yet motherly, soothing, supportive - SH has been her loyal follower up to this point, and Shar wishes her to make a final sacrifice. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

70.speaker: Shar
70.text: Once, they were among the most fanatical of my sister Selûne's followers, but for years they have been here, resisting my embrace.
70.context: NodeContext: (Selûne = seh-LOO-nuh) All-poweful, yet motherly, soothing, supportive - SH has been her loyal follower up to this point, and Shar wishes her to make a final sacrifice. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

14.speaker: Shar
14.text: Just as I wished them to.
14.context: NodeContext: All-poweful, yet motherly, soothing, supportive - SH has been her loyal follower up to this point, and Shar wishes her to make a final sacrifice. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

167.speaker: Shar
167.text: Their wrongheaded resolve allowed me to shape you. But I need not tell you - I can show you. It is time to remember. Time to remember everything.
167.context: NodeContext: All-poweful, yet motherly, soothing, supportive - SH has been her loyal follower up to this point, and Shar wishes her to make a final sacrifice. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

155.speaker: Narrator
155.text: *You find yourself thrust into Shadowheart's mind, but it's different than before. There's more. More than you - or she - can comprehend. A flood of restored memories, finished thoughts, revealed secrets...*
155.context: CinematicNodeContext: A surge of darkness overtakes the player. The tadpole jolts, assailing them with psionic power. The darkness consumes them.

182.speaker: Shadowheart
182.context: NodeContext: Quiet shock. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

50.speaker: Shadowheart
50.text: Yes... I remember it all. I remember them - my parents.
50.context: NodeContext: Quiet shock. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

78.speaker: Shadowheart
78.text: What have you done to them?!
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Angry outburst directed at a huge looming visage of SharNodeContext: Angry outburst directed at a huge looming visage of Shar. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

197.speaker: Shar
197.text: We, child. We did this to them together. My power, and your will.
197.context: NodeContext: All-poweful, yet motherly, soothing, supportive - SH has been her loyal follower up to this point, and Shar wishes her to make a final sacrifice. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

136.speaker: Emmeline Hallowleaf
136.text: Jenevelle? Jen? Is that you? Why, you look so tall...
136.context: NodeContext: A little dazed and faraway. She's been through a lot

153.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
153.text: It's not her, Emm. It's just another trick. Another way to hurt us.
153.context: NodeContext: Trying to rally his wife's nerves

130.speaker: Shadowheart
130.context: NodeContext: Choking back emotion Jen-eh-vel. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

137.speaker: Shar
137.text: Jenevelle is no more. She never left those dark woods - it was Shadowheart who emerged. This woman gave birth to you, but I made you. I am your Mother.
137.context: NodeContext: Jen-eh-vel. All-poweful, yet motherly, soothing, supportive - SH has been her loyal follower up to this point, and Shar wishes her to make a final sacrifice. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Why are you doing this? She didn't need to know.

57.speaker: Shar
57.text: A sacrifice is not a sacrifice if it has no meaning. This is the final step - snuff out the last embers of your old life, so that you can finally be who you were meant to be.
57.context: NodeContext: All-poweful, yet motherly, soothing, supportive - SH has been her loyal follower up to this point, and Shar wishes her to make a final sacrifice. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

34.speaker: Shar
34.text: Kill them, for me. Then I will take the memories away from you again. Loss will heal you, and you will be my right hand, at last.
34.context: NodeContext: All-poweful, yet motherly, soothing, supportive - SH has been her loyal follower up to this point, and Shar wishes her to make a final sacrifice. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

93.speaker: Shar
93.context: NodeContext: Firm. The soothing tones from before are quickly fading. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: You're a monster, not a goddess.

143.speaker: Shar
143.text: I am neither. I am nothing. I am the empty room. The dreamless sleep. The shadow's shadow.
143.context: NodeContext: Cold and imperious. Soothing tone has wilted away. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

141.speaker: Shar
141.text: There was no pain before my sister set the sun aflame. Now you exist to suffer, until you find your way back to my embrace.
141.context: NodeContext: Cold and imperious. Soothing tone has wilted away. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Kill them, Shadowheart. They'll be forgotten again, soon enough.

114.speaker: Shadowheart
114.text: They're my parents... I don't know if I can.
114.context: NodeContext: Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

193.speaker: Shar
193.text: Do you remember your training, child? I know you do.
193.context: NodeContext: Cold and imperious. Soothing tone has wilted away. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

116.speaker: Shar
116.text: All the times you stood in this room, wondering why this pair seemed so familiar. All the times you honed your skills on them.
116.context: NodeContext: Cold and imperious. Soothing tone has wilted away. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

73.speaker: Shar
73.text: They remember everything. The pain. The pleading. Their torturer, wearing their daughter's face. End their nightmare. Give them peace.
73.context: NodeContext: Cold and imperious. Soothing tone has wilted away. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

195.speaker: Shadowheart
195.text: I have to do it. My whole life has been leading to this.
195.context: NodeContext: Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

133.speaker: Player
133.text: Your whole life's been a lie. You don't have to do this.

53.speaker: Shar
53.text: Do your duty - this one final trial. Then you will be whole.
53.context: NodeContext: Cold and imperious. Soothing tone has wilted away. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

115.speaker: Shadowheart
115.text: No. You've already brought me to what I need. My family. My real family.
115.context: NodeContext: Rising defiance. Standing up to a goddess. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

101.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
101.text: Don't anger her, Jen. Just get out. Save yourself.

127.speaker: Shadowheart
127.context: NodeContext: Quiet resolve. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

61.speaker: Shadowheart
61.text: I'm leaving this place. And I'm taking my parents with me.
61.context: NodeContext: Defiant. Addressed to Shar. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

88.speaker: Shar
88.text: So much was done to mould you, and still you turn your back on me, for two strangers that you share blood with?
88.context: NodeContext: Cold and imperious. Soothing tone has wilted away. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

148.speaker: Shar
148.text: Go then, leave - the dark will still be waiting. But keep some memories as a parting gift.
148.context: NodeContext: Cold and imperious. Soothing tone has wilted away. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

21.speaker: Shar
21.text: You learned so much, applying your skills to these two. Now you can remember it all, whenever you look upon their faces.
21.context: NodeContext: Cold and imperious. Soothing tone has wilted away. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

100.speaker: Shadowheart
100.text: I... I did that? Gods, how did I do that to them... so many times?
100.context: NodeContext: Horror. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

68.speaker: Shar
68.text: You showed great promise, but no more. When the darkness finally comes for you again, it will not be my welcoming embrace - it will be a hungry maw, then nothing. Farewell.
68.context: NodeContext: Cold and imperious. Soothing tone has wilted away. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shar's visage fades away. The dark aura in the chamber of loss recedes.

7.speaker: Shadowheart
7.text: I... I hurt you both. So much. Gods forgive me...
7.context: NodeContext: Distraught/shamed. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

176.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
176.text: There is nothing to forgive. You did what was necessary. To survive.

86.speaker: Emmeline Hallowleaf
86.text: And you came back to us. What more could a mother want?

180.context: CinematicNodeContext:  Shadowheart's hand begins to glow with Selûnite power. It intensifies, engulfing her and her parents. The player turns away... the glow fades. The sharran discs have vanished. SH's parents are now free of their restraints, weak on their feet. Shadowheart embraces them gently.

33.speaker: Shadowheart
33.text: I will be. Once we all get clear of this place.
33.context: NodeContext: Gathering herself. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

134.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
134.text: Do what you need to, Jen. We can follow your trail once we've rested a little. The Moonmaiden still guides us.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: I don't mean to rush the moment, but we shouldn't linger here.

125.speaker: Shadowheart
125.text: No, you're right to urge haste. There'll be time for a proper reunion later - let's get clear of this place.
125.context: NodeContext: Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

16.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
16.text: Whatever happens, we love you all the same.

20.speaker: Emmeline Hallowleaf
20.text: We never stopped. Thank you, Moonmaiden. You let me see my Jenevelle, my baby girl, one last time.

183.speaker: Shadowheart
183.text: Don't call me that. My name is Shadowheart.
183.context: NodeContext: Conflicted/clinging to her SH identity. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

191.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
191.text: You are just lost, Jenevelle. Selûne will show you the way home, in time -

152.speaker: Shadowheart
152.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH's power flares wildly, engulfing the pair. Their Sharran disc restraints vanish and they collapse to the floor, dead. Shadowheart drops to her knees, in shock.NodeContext: Anger/emotion blowing over. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

27.speaker: Shar
27.text: It is done. And done well. They are with me now, in my endless dark. And from them, you can draw endless power.
27.context: NodeContext: Proud, triumphant. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

24.speaker: Shadowheart
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH is on her kneesNodeContext: Dazed shock after killing her parents.  Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

118.speaker: Shar
118.text: No longer. Forget. Forget and rise.
118.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The dark aura fades.

Shadowheart blinks, the shocked expression slipping from her face. She stands and gives the player a look.
NodeContext: Proud, triumphant. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

41.speaker: Shadowheart
41.text: It's done. This place is mine now. Shar's forces are mine, when I need them. And her power... it's right at my fingertips. I can't believe it.
41.context: NodeContext: clear-minded and euphoric. Forgotten that she's just killed her parentsPath 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: I can - you killed your parents for this.

132.speaker: Shadowheart
132.text: Don't be ridiculous - I never knew my parents. Whoever these poor wretches were, they're strangers to me.
132.context: NodeContext: Disbelieving. Forgotten that she's just killed her parentsPath 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

177.speaker: Shadowheart
177.text: It's time we left. We're not finished with the Absolute just yet. Only now, Shar's forces are mine to command, when the battle comes.
177.context: NodeContext: Full of resolve. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Those two corpses - do you know who they are?

172.speaker: Shadowheart
172.text: Sacrifices. My final test, whoever they are. A rather meagre offering to the Dark Lady... but it is not my place to question her.
172.context: NodeContext: Dismissive. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

30.speaker: Shadowheart
30.text: Yes. But we're not finished with the Absolute just yet. Only now, Lady Shar's forces are mine to command, when the battle comes.
30.context: NodeContext: Full of resolve. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: It's not worth it. Shar will turn on you in time, same as she did Viconia.

170.speaker: Player
170.text: They're your parents. They'll forgive you.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: Do whatever you feel is right, Shadowheart.

157.speaker: Shadowheart
157.text: What's right... Have I ever known what that truly is?
157.context: NodeContext: Pensive/conflicted. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

1.speaker: Shadowheart
1.text: Do what's right. I think I lost sight of that some time ago. Better to just serve blindly.
1.context: NodeContext: Fatalistic. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

184.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
184.text: It can't be. Another vile trick...
184.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart approaches two upright discs upon which an elf man and human woman are restrained to each. (This should be reminiscent of the figure SH glimpsed in Shar's symbol during her vision after killing Nightsong). The elf man lifts his head to see Shadowheart and reacts with disbelief. His disc flares. He breaks off with a cry of pain.

31.speaker: Emmeline Hallowleaf
31.text: No... there is no trick. It's her. Jenevelle. Jen. Our little girl.

63.speaker: Shadowheart
63.text: I'm here to get you out of here. They're all gone, it's over -
63.context: NodeContext: Urgent, cut off by a wince of pain at the end. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

174.context: CinematicNodeContext: A dark aura pulses from the black mirror, casting shadows throughout the chamber. Shadowheart doubles over in pain as her incurable wound flares intensely. Her parents also writhe in agony. Finally it abates and Shadowheart straightens - to see a vast silhouette of Shar leaning over her and her parents. Shar's features cannot be clearly seen, but her words reverberate through SH's head.

166.speaker: Shar
166.context: CinematicNodeContext:  Shadowheart doubles over in pain as her incurable wound flares intensely. Her parents also writhe in agony on their disc-restaints. Finally it abates and Shadowheart standsNodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose -starts with left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left. Then lowers the sword arm to her side (out of view for player) and stands looming over SH and co, left hand still appearing to hold them up.

158.speaker: Shar
158.text: You see? It matters not if you raze this place, if you slay every one of your brothers and sisters. That was never where my power resided.
158.context: NodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose -starts with left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left. Then lowers the sword arm to her side (out of view for player) and stands looming over SH and co, left hand still appearing to hold them up.

108.speaker: Shar
108.text: Every time you try to step away from me, every time you try to reach for Selûne, my hold on you bites deeper.
108.context: NodeContext: (Selûne = seh-LOO-nuh)Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose -starts with left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left. Then lowers the sword arm to her side (out of view for player) and stands looming over SH and co, left hand still appearing to hold them up.

55.speaker: Shar
55.text: If you had learned, if you had obeyed, there would be no pain. But you struggle on. You make things worse for yourself. And for them.
55.context: NodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose -starts with left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left. Then lowers the sword arm to her side (out of view for player) and stands looming over SH and co, left hand still appearing to hold them up.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: You're a monster, not a goddess.

2.speaker: Shar
2.text: I am neither. I am nothing. I am the empty room. The dreamless sleep. The shadow's shadow.
2.context: NodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose -starts with left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left. Then lowers the sword arm to her side (out of view for player) and stands looming over SH and co, left hand still appearing to hold them up.

149.speaker: Shar
149.text: There was no pain before my sister set the sun aflame. Now you exist to suffer, until you find your way back to my embrace.
149.context: NodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose -starts with left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left. Then lowers the sword arm to her side (out of view for player) and stands looming over SH and co, left hand still appearing to hold them up.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Ignore her, Shadowheart. She's just trying to spite your victory.

123.speaker: Shar
123.text: Victory? Your victory is but a guttering candle in the dark. Temporary. Inconsequential.
123.context: NodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose -starts with left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left. Then lowers the sword arm to her side (out of view for player) and stands looming over SH and co, left hand still appearing to hold them up.

18.speaker: Shadowheart
18.text: Enough. I'm taking my parents away from here. I'm taking them away from you.
18.context: NodeContext: Defiant. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

12.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
12.text: You cannot. We are still bound to you. You cannot both free us and free yourself from her curse.

47.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
47.text: The Moonmaiden needs you more than she needs us. You are the future - you must return to the fold. We are the past. And our duty is almost done.

122.speaker: Shar
122.text: Eloquently put. His mind stood up well to his time here. The same cannot be said for your mother - such brief, fragile lives humans lead.
122.context: NodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose -starts with left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left. Then lowers the sword arm to her side (out of view for player) and stands looming over SH and co, left hand still appearing to hold them up.

142.speaker: Shar
142.text: This is my final lesson. I leave you now, to dwell on your mistakes and make your choice.
142.context: NodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose -starts with left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left. Then lowers the sword arm to her side (out of view for player) and stands looming over SH and co, left hand still appearing to hold them up.

159.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shar's silhouette melts away and the dark Shadowfell aura fades. The room is as it was before.

173.speaker: Narrator
173.text: *Shar's parting words make your flesh crawl. There is no lesson to be learned here - only a family's torment, a spiteful goddess' whims, and an unspeakable choice to be made...*

11.speaker: Shadowheart
11.context: NodeContext: Confused. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

162.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
162.text: Shar will never admit defeat - not until she has stolen one last thing from you. We cannot allow your future to be her last prize - not after all your mother and I have endured to see you again.

49.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
49.text: You companion understands, I think. Help her, please. Help her see what must be done.
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Glances from SH to player to share a look of understandingNodeContext: Referring to player while addressing SH for first line. Addressing player with the second. A solemn, dignified plea.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: You have to choose, Shadowheart. Free your parents, or rid yourself of Shar's curse.

46.speaker: Shadowheart
46.text: No, I can't. I came here for them.
46.context: NodeContext: Shock/dismay. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

150.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
150.text: And you did. You found us.

81.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
81.text: All these years, that dream kept us going, that you would break free. No matter what they made you do to us, we knew you were still in there.

6.speaker: Emmeline Hallowleaf
6.text: I knew the dark woods wouldn't frighten you. You were always such a brave girl.

80.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
80.text: She was. And still is. You've saved us. Now save yourself. You'll be out of Shar's reach, and we'll be at peace.

192.speaker: Shadowheart
192.text: But I only just found you again, after all this time. I can't lose you again.
192.context: NodeContext: Rising emotion/upset. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

181.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
181.text: We'll still be with you. By the Moonmaiden's grace, we'll never be far. Please, Jenevelle.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: You should end their suffering, and yours.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Do not lose your parents, not again. The pain can be handled.

74.speaker: Shadowheart
74.text: But the curse. We'll just have to go on like this... suffering.
74.context: NodeContext: Unsure/overwhelmed. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: You have great faith and great resolve - all of you. Trust in that. You need not say goodbye here.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: You can endure it together, as a family. This is what you've been looking for - don't deny yourself.

62.speaker: Shadowheart
62.text: I didn't come this far just to give up at the final hurdle. We're leaving this place together. I'm going to take care of you.
62.context: NodeContext: Defiant/resolved. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

189.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
189.text: Our time has passed, Jenevelle. You must not let us burden you.

3.speaker: Shadowheart
3.text: You're no burden. You're my strength. I think I know where my wilful side comes from now.

129.speaker: Emmeline Hallowleaf
129.text: Hush, Arnell. Jen wants her family. Jen shall have her family. How can we help, dear?

98.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart's hand begins to glow with Selûnite power. It intensifies, engulfing her and her parents. The player turns away... the glow fades. The sharran discs have vanished. SH's parents are now free of their restraints, weak on their feet. Shadowheart embraces them gently.

109.speaker: Shadowheart
109.text: Get out of this place, as soon as your strength allows. There's a camp - you'll be safe there.

64.speaker: Shadowheart
64.text: I'm sorry... I need to obey my parents' wishes, this once. If you are sure this is what you want...?
64.context: NodeContext: Resigned. First sentence addressed to player. 'If you are sure this is what you want...?' addressed to parents. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

69.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
69.text: It is what we need, all of us.

9.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
9.text: You were meant to be a guiding light for Selûne's faithful, but they robbed you from us. Now that can be righted, and we can rest.

96.speaker: Emmeline Hallowleaf
96.text: Help us, Jen. I can let go, now I've seen your face again.

113.speaker: Shadowheart
113.context: NodeContext: Choking up. About to euthanize her parents. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

19.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart's hand begins to glow with Selûnite power. It intensifies, engulfing her and her parents. The player turns away...

... the glow fades. Shadowheart's parents are gone. In their place are two floating motes of light. They dance gently in the air before Shadowheart. She smiles at them.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: I'm sorry that it came to this.

54.speaker: Shadowheart
54.text: Don't be. They're free now, as am I. And part of them is still here with me.
54.context: NodeContext: At peace after giving her parents the death they asked for. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

17.context: CinematicNodeContext: The moon motes flit away offscreen as if guiding her out of the chamber.

102.speaker: Shadowheart
102.text: Let's leave this place. There's nothing more for me here.
102.context: NodeContext: At peace after giving her parents the death they asked for. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

187.speaker: Shadowheart
187.text: I don't know where home is anymore... but it's not here.
187.context: NodeContext: Spoken with some finality. Her journey against Shar is done. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: One thing - what should I call you now? Shadowheart? Jenevelle?

146.speaker: Shadowheart
146.text: Shadowheart, still. I can't run away from who I was for all this time. Besides, there's something fitting to it - you can't cast a shadow without some light.
146.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, at peace with herself. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: What about your memories? Isn't there more that was taken from you?

91.speaker: Shadowheart
91.text: More? Most, I should think. I doubt Shar will be given over to generosity... Best if I just consider them lost. I have everything I need to make new memories. As for this place, all I did here...
91.context: NodeContext: Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

196.speaker: Shadowheart
196.context: NodeContext: Spoken with some finality. Her journey against Shar is done. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

178.speaker: Player
178.text: They are with the Moonmaiden now.

104.speaker: Shadowheart
104.text: In a way. But they're also right here - look.
104.context: NodeContext: At peace after giving her parents the death they asked for. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

156.speaker: Shadowheart
156.text: Moon motes. They bring Selûne's light to dark places and offer guidance to those in need.
156.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH looks at the surrounding moon motes dancing aroundNodeContext: (Selûne = seh-LOO-nuh) At peace after giving her parents the death they asked for. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

58.speaker: Shadowheart
58.text: My parents are watching over me.
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH smiles at the motes. NodeContext: At peace after giving her parents the death they asked for. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

154.speaker: Player
154.text: You forced Lady Shar's hand and paid the price. I hope your freedom is worth it.

110.speaker: Shadowheart
110.text: To be free of Shar? To end my parents' suffering and show them it wasn't all in vain?
110.context: NodeContext: Defiant - she's cut ties with Shar forever. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

175.speaker: Shadowheart
175.text: Yes. It was worth it. No words of yours can diminish that.
175.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH smiles at the motes (while the line is directed at the player)NodeContext: Defiant - she's cut ties with Shar forever. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: This is your choice, Shadowheart. You don't need me to tell you what is right.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: The Dark Lady offers you a rare kindness. Give the prisoners a merciful death. End your pain.

0.speaker: Shadowheart
0.text: And replace it with another. Don't ask me to kill my parents, please. I can't live with that.
0.context: NodeContext: pleading. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

169.speaker: Shar
169.text: The price of insubordination. You could have been blissfully ignorant if you stayed in my embrace. But you strayed. And now you choose.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Let your parents die with honour. They will become Selûne's martyrs, and you will be free.

8.speaker: Shadowheart
8.text: Free, but with the memory of what I've done. Don't ask me to kill my parents, please. I can't live with that.
8.context: NodeContext: pleading. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

35.speaker: Shadowheart
35.text: Is this truly what you want?
35.context: NodeContext: Solemn, address to parents. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: She wants you to kill your parents. Her idea of a parting gift.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Talk to your mother and father. See what they wish.

188.speaker: Shadowheart
188.text: I'm... I'm sorry. I didn't know any of this was happening until it was much too late. I came to try put things right.
188.context: NodeContext: Ashamed/contrite. Talking to her parents. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

168.speaker: Shar
168.text: Leave? You should never have come. You should have hidden away forever.
168.context: NodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose -starts with left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left. Then lowers the sword arm to her side (out of view for player) and stands looming over SH and co, left hand still appearing to hold them up.
